org.usfirst.frc.team449.robot.components

Class RotPerSecCANTalonSRX

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.usfirst.frc.team449.robot.components.RotPerSecCANTalonSRX

  • public class RotPerSecCANTalonSRX
extends java.lang.Object
    Component wrapper on the CTRE CANTalon, with unit conversions to/from RPS built in. Every non-unit-conversion in this class takes arguments in post-gearing RPS.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RotPerSecCANTalonSRX(int port, boolean inverted, boolean enableBrakeMode, double fwdPeakOutputVoltage, java.lang.Double revPeakOutputVoltage, double highGearFwdNominalOutputVoltage, java.lang.Double highGearRevNominalOutputVoltage, java.lang.Double lowGearFwdNominalOutputVoltage, java.lang.Double lowGearRevNominalOutputVoltage, java.lang.Boolean fwdLimitSwitchNormallyOpen, java.lang.Boolean revLimitSwitchNormallyOpen, java.lang.Double fwdSoftLimit, java.lang.Double revSoftLimit, java.lang.Double postEncoderGearing, java.lang.Double closedLoopRampRate, java.lang.Double inchesPerRotation, java.lang.Integer currentLimit, com.ctre.CANTalon.FeedbackDevice feedbackDevice, java.lang.Integer encoderCPR, java.lang.Boolean reverseSensor, java.lang.Double maxSpeedHigh, int highGearP, int highGearI, int highGearD, java.lang.Double maxSpeedLow, int lowGearP, int lowGearI, int lowGearD, int motionProfileP, int motionProfileI, int motionProfileD, boolean MPUseLowGear, java.util.List<org.usfirst.frc.team449.robot.components.RotPerSecCANTalonSRX.SlaveTalon> slaves)
      Default constructor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RotPerSecCANTalonSRX

        public RotPerSecCANTalonSRX(int port,
                            boolean inverted,
                            boolean enableBrakeMode,
                            double fwdPeakOutputVoltage,
                            @Nullable
                            java.lang.Double revPeakOutputVoltage,
                            double highGearFwdNominalOutputVoltage,
                            @Nullable
                            java.lang.Double highGearRevNominalOutputVoltage,
                            @Nullable
                            java.lang.Double lowGearFwdNominalOutputVoltage,
                            @Nullable
                            java.lang.Double lowGearRevNominalOutputVoltage,
                            @Nullable
                            java.lang.Boolean fwdLimitSwitchNormallyOpen,
                            @Nullable
                            java.lang.Boolean revLimitSwitchNormallyOpen,
                            @Nullable
                            java.lang.Double fwdSoftLimit,
                            @Nullable
                            java.lang.Double revSoftLimit,
                            @Nullable
                            java.lang.Double postEncoderGearing,
                            @Nullable
                            java.lang.Double closedLoopRampRate,
                            @Nullable
                            java.lang.Double inchesPerRotation,
                            @Nullable
                            java.lang.Integer currentLimit,
                            @Nullable
                            com.ctre.CANTalon.FeedbackDevice feedbackDevice,
                            @Nullable
                            java.lang.Integer encoderCPR,
                            @Nullable
                            java.lang.Boolean reverseSensor,
                            @Nullable
                            java.lang.Double maxSpeedHigh,
                            int highGearP,
                            int highGearI,
                            int highGearD,
                            @Nullable
                            java.lang.Double maxSpeedLow,
                            int lowGearP,
                            int lowGearI,
                            int lowGearD,
                            int motionProfileP,
                            int motionProfileI,
                            int motionProfileD,
                            boolean MPUseLowGear,
                            @Nullable
                            java.util.List<org.usfirst.frc.team449.robot.components.RotPerSecCANTalonSRX.SlaveTalon> slaves)
        Default constructor.
        Parameters:
        port - CAN port of this Talon.
        inverted - Whether this Talon is inverted.
        enableBrakeMode - Whether to brake or coast when stopped.
        fwdPeakOutputVoltage - The peak voltage in the forward direction, in volts. If revPeakOutputVoltage is null, this is used for peak voltage in both directions. Should be a positive or zero.
        revPeakOutputVoltage - The peak voltage in the reverse direction. Can be null, and if it is, fwdPeakOutputVoltage is used as the peak voltage in both directions. Should be positive or zero.
        highGearFwdNominalOutputVoltage - The minimum non-zero voltage in the forward direction in the high/only gear, in volts. If highGearRevNominalOutputVoltage is null, this is used for nominal voltage in both directions. Should be a positive or zero.
        highGearRevNominalOutputVoltage - The minimum non-zero voltage in the reverse direction in the high/only gear. Can be null, and if it is, highGearFwdNominalOutputVoltage is used as the nominal voltage in both directions. Should be positive or zero.
        lowGearFwdNominalOutputVoltage - The minimum non-zero voltage in the forward direction in the high/only gear, in volts. If highGearRevNominalOutputVoltage is null, this is used for nominal voltage in both directions. Should be a positive or zero. Can be null if this Talon doesn't have a low gear.
        lowGearRevNominalOutputVoltage - The minimum non-zero voltage in the reverse direction in the high/only gear. Can be null, and if it is, highGearFwdNominalOutputVoltage is used as the nominal voltage in both directions. Should be positive or zero.
        fwdLimitSwitchNormallyOpen - Whether the forward limit switch is normally open or closed. If this is null, the forward limit switch is disabled.
        revLimitSwitchNormallyOpen - Whether the reverse limit switch is normally open or closed. If this is null, the reverse limit switch is disabled.
        fwdSoftLimit - The forward software limit. If this is null, the forward software limit is disabled. TODO figure out units
        revSoftLimit - The reverse software limit. If this is null, the reverse software limit is disabled. TODO figure out units
        postEncoderGearing - The coefficient the output changes by after being measured by the encoder, e.g. this would be 1/70 if there was a 70:1 gearing between the encoder and the final output. Defaults to 1.
        closedLoopRampRate - The voltage ramp rate for closed-loop velocity control. Can be null, and if it is, no ramp rate is used.
        inchesPerRotation - The number of inches travelled per rotation of the motor this is attached to.
        currentLimit - The max amps this device can draw. If this is null, no current limit is used.
        feedbackDevice - The type of encoder used to measure the output velocity of this motor. Can be null if there is no encoder attached to this Talon.
        encoderCPR - The counts per rotation of the encoder on this Talon. Can be null if feedbackDevice is, but otherwise must have a value.
        reverseSensor - Whether or not to reverse the reading from the encoder on this Talon. Can be null if feedbackDevice is, but otherwise must have a value.
        maxSpeedHigh - The high gear max speed, in RPS. If this motor doesn't have gears, then this is just the max speed. Used to calculate velocity PIDF feed-forward. Can be null, and if it is, it's assumed that this motor won't use velocity closed-loop control.
        highGearP - The proportional gain for high gear. Defaults to 0.
        highGearI - The integral gain for high gear. Defaults to 0.
        highGearD - The derivative gain for high gear. Defaults to 0.
        maxSpeedLow - The low gear max speed in RPS. Used to calculate velocity PIDF feed-forward. Can be null, and if it is, it's assumed that either this motor doesn't have a low gear or the low gear won't use velocity closed-loop control.
        lowGearP - The proportional gain for low gear. Defaults to 0.
        lowGearI - The integral gain for low gear. Defaults to 0.
        lowGearD - The derivative gain for low gear. Defaults to 0.
        motionProfileP - The proportional gain for motion profiles. Defaults to 0.
        motionProfileI - The integral gain for high motion profiles. Defaults to 0.
        motionProfileD - The derivative gain for high motion profiles. Defaults to 0.
        MPUseLowGear - Whether this motor uses high or low gear for running motion profiles. Defaults to false.
        slaves - The other CANTalons that are slaved to this one.

      • setPercentVbus

        public void setPercentVbus(double percentVbus)
        Give a PercentVbus setpoint (set to PercentVbus mode and set)
        Parameters:
        percentVbus - percent of total voltage from [-1, 1]

        public void switchToHighGear()
        Switch to using the high gear PID constants and nominal voltage.

      • switchToLowGear

        public void switchToLowGear()
        Switch to using the low gear PID constants and nominal output voltages if we have them.

      • getMaxSpeed

        @Nullable
public java.lang.Double getMaxSpeed()
        Get the max speed of the gear the talon is currently in.
        Returns:
        max speed, in RPS, as given in the map, or null if no value given.

      • encoderToRPS

        @Nullable
public java.lang.Double encoderToRPS(double encoderReading)
        Converts the velocity read by the talon's getSpeed() method to the RPS of the output shaft. Note this DOES account for post-encoder gearing.
        Parameters:
        encoderReading - The velocity read from the encoder with no conversions.
        Returns:
        The velocity of the output shaft, in RPS, when the encoder has that reading, or null if no encoder CPR was given.

      • RPSToEncoder

        @Nullable
public java.lang.Double RPSToEncoder(double RPS)
        Converts from the velocity of the output shaft to what the talon's getSpeed() method would read at that velocity. Note this DOES account for post-encoder gearing.
        Parameters:
        RPS - The velocity of the output shaft, in RPS.
        Returns:
        What the raw encoder reading would be at that velocity, or null if no encoder CPR was given.

      • getSpeed

        @Nullable
public java.lang.Double getSpeed()
        Get the velocity of the CANTalon in RPS

        Note: This method is called getSpeed since the CANTalon method is called getSpeed. However, the output is signed and is actually a velocity.

        Returns:
        The CANTalon's velocity in RPS, or null if no encoder CPR was given.

      • setSpeed

        public void setSpeed(double velocitySp)
        Give a velocity closed loop setpoint in RPS

        Note: This method is called setSpeed since the CANTalon method is called getSpeed. However, the input argument is signed and is actually a velocity.

        Parameters:
        velocitySp - velocity setpoint in revolutions per second

      • getError

        @Nullable
public java.lang.Double getError()
        Get the current closed-loop velocity error in RPS. WARNING: will give garbage if not in velocity mode.
        Returns:
        The closed-loop error in RPS, or null if no encoder CPR was given.

      • getSetpoint

        @Nullable
public java.lang.Double getSetpoint()
        Get the current velocity setpoint of the Talon in RPS. WARNING: will give garbage if not in velocity mode.
        Returns:
        The closed-loop velocity setpoint in RPS, or null if no encoder CPR was given.

      • getMaxSpeedHG

        @Nullable
public java.lang.Double getMaxSpeedHG()
        Get the high gear max speed. Used for for scaling joystick output.
        Returns:
        The high gear max speed in RPS, or null if none was given.

      • getPower

        public double getPower()
        Get the amount of power the Talon is currently drawing from the PDP.
        Returns:
        Power in watts.

      • nativeToFeet

        @Nullable
public java.lang.Double nativeToFeet(double nativeUnits)
        Convert from native units read by an encoder to feet moved. Note this DOES account for post-encoder gearing.
        Parameters:
        nativeUnits - A distance native units as measured by the encoder.
        Returns:
        That distance in feet, or null if no encoder CPR or inches per rotation was given.

      • feetToNative

        @Nullable
public java.lang.Double feetToNative(double feet)
        Convert a distance from feet to encoder reading in native units. Note this DOES account for post-encoder gearing.
        Parameters:
        feet - A distance in feet.
        Returns:
        That distance in native units as measured by the encoder, or null if no encoder CPR or inches per rotation was given.

      • feetPerSecToNative

        @Nullable
public java.lang.Double feetPerSecToNative(double fps)
        Convert a velocity from feet per second to encoder units. Note this DOES account for post-encoder gearing.
        Parameters:
        fps - A velocity in feet per second
        Returns:
        That velocity in either native units or RPS, depending on the type of encoder, or null if no encoder CPR or inches per rotation was given.

      • nativeToFeetPerSec

        @Nullable
public java.lang.Double nativeToFeetPerSec(double nativeUnits)
        Convert a velocity from encoder units to feet per second. Note this DOES account for post-encoder gearing.
        Parameters:
        nativeUnits - A velocity in either native units or RPS, depending on the type of encoder.
        Returns:
        That velocity in feet per second, or null if no encoder CPR or inches per rotation was given.

      • getCanTalon

        @NotNull
public com.ctre.CANTalon getCanTalon()
        Get the CANTalon this is a wrapper on.
        Returns:
        The canTalon this wraps.
